fields.value: Metro Court Project: A Study of Mediation and Adjudication in Bernalillo County (Albuquerque), New Mexico, Small Claims Court, 1990-1992

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study used court records and interviews with   disputants, litigants, and mediators in Bernalillo County, New Mexico,   to compare the effects of ethnicity and gender in mediated versus   adjudicated small claims disputes. Initial structured telephone   interviews with both adjudicated and mediated claimants and respondents   (Parts 1-4) were conducted. Follow-up questionnaires (Parts 6-8) were   then administered to the initial interviewed groups. Data from   mediators (Part 9) were collected from self-administered structured   questionnaires. Pertinent questions from all eight survey instruments   were combined into a master file (Part 5). This data collection also   includes two qualitative summary files of adjudicated and mediated  cases (Parts 10-11). The unit of analysis is the small claims case.

These files included additional setup files as well  as one or more of the following: SAS  program, SAS transport, SPSS portable,   and Stata system files. The  metadata record was revised  2005-11-04 to  reflect these additions.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS, SPSS, and Stata setup files, SAS transport file, and SPSS portable file;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) Parts 10 and 11 of this collection are text files   that are qualitative summaries of mediated and adjudicated cases. (2)   The original questionnaires are available only in hardcopy form upon  request from ICPSR.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Stata system file(s), SPSS portable file(s), Data file(s), SAS transport - XPORT engine file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: administrative records data, survey data, and  machine-readable text
Bernalillo County, New Mexico, small claims court  records (claims, answers, and judgments) and mediated agreements
All non-eviction small claims cases (less than $5,000) with   adult individuals, married couples, or businesses on both sides that  proceeded to hearing or mediation with both parties present.

fields.value: A random selection of adjudicated cases and a random  assignment of answered claims to mediation.
